Course Description: INTERMEDIATE FINANCIAL REPORTING III FOCUSES ON TOPICS IN FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING MEASUREMENT, INCLUDING REPORTING OF INCOME TAXES, ACCOUNTING CHANGES AND CORRECTION OF ERRORS, REVENUE MEASUREMENT, LEASES, PENSIONS, CASH FLOW, FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS, INTERIM FINANCIAL REPORTS, AND REPORTING FOR SEGMENTS OF A BUSINESS ENTERPRISE.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
APPLY CURRENT ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS, PRINCIPLES, AND STANDARDS (GAAP AND IFRS) TO BUSINESS AND EXAMINE THE ETHICAL IMPLICATIONS TO REAL-WORLD SCENARIOS AND PROBLEMS.
DEMONSTRATE A PROFICIENCY IN USING THE ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION.
EXAMINE THE CRITERIA AND CONDITIONS USED TO CLASSIFY LEASES AND IDENTIFY CIRCUMSTANCES THAT MOTIVATE LEASING. 
DETERMINE THE PURPOSE OF THE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS AND PREPARE A CASH FLOW STATEMENT USING THE INDIRECT AND DIRECT METHOD. 
DEMONSTRATE THE RECORDING OF MISCELLANEOUS TOPICS, INCLUDING ACCOUNTING CHANGES, ERROR CORRECTIONS, AND PRIOR-PERIOD ADJUSTMENTS.
APPLY ACCOUNTING PROCEDURES WITH RESPECT TO DEFERRED TAX RECOGNITION, VALUATION, AND INCOME TAX ALLOCATION.
ANALYZE THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE EMPLOYERS PENSION PLAN AND THE ACCOUNTING FOR THE PENSION FUND AND EXPLAIN THE ALTERNATIVE MEASURES FOR VALUING THE PENSION OBLIGATION.
EXAMINE THE USE OF NOTES IN FINANCIAL STATEMENT PREPARATION AND DESCRIBE THE REQUIREMENTS FOR MAJOR BUSINESS SEGMENTS AND INTERIM REPORTING.
EVALUATE THE CURRENT INTERNATIONAL ACCOUNTING ENVIRONMENT AND IDENTIFY THE KEY PARTICIPANTS.
DEMONSTRATE PROFICIENCY IN APPLYING PROPER ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS TO COMPLEX ACCOUNTING ISSUES.
